property.name: Text
property.value: Each Dale character you control with a player attachment gets +1 Ò. Response: After you play an attachment on a Dale character without an attachment, draw a card.

property.name: Text
property.value: While playing an Item attachment, Bard son of Brand is considered to have the printed Ì, Î, and Ï icons. Response: When a character leaves play, return each attachment attached to that character to its owner’s hand. (Limit once per phase.)

property.name: Text
property.value: Reduce the cost to play Armor attachments on Redwater Sentry by 1. Redwater Sentry gets +1 Ú and gains Sentinel while it has an Armor attachment.

property.name: Text
property.value: North Realm Lookout gets +1 Ò and does not exhaust to quest while it has an Item attachment.

property.name: Text
property.value: Reduce the cost to play Weapon attachments on Warrior of Dale by 1. Warrior of Dale gets +1 Û and gains Ranged while it has a Weapon attachment.

property.name: Text
property.value: Action: Exhaust Long Lake Trader to move an Item attachment from a character you control to another eligible character.

property.name: Text
property.value: Attach to a Dale or Warrior character. Limit 1 per character. Attached character gets +1 Ú (and +1 hit point if attached character has the sentinel keyword).

property.name: Text
property.value: Attach to a Dale or Esgaroth hero. Planning Action: Exhaust King of Dale to reduce the cost of the next Dale ally you play this phase by 1 for each different player attachment on attached hero. That ally does not require a resource match.

property.name: Text
property.value: Attach to a Dale or Warrior character. Restricted. Response: After attached character is declared as an attacker, exhaust Bow of Yew to deal 1 damage to the defending enemy.

property.name: Text
property.value: Attach to a Dale or Scout character. Limit 1 per character. Response: After attached character commits to the quest, place 1 progress on the active location.

property.name: Text
property.value: Guarded (enemy or location) Attach to a hero. Attached hero gets +2 Ò and collects an additional resource during the resource phase.

property.name: Text
property.value: Planning Action: Choose a Dale hero you control. Add 1 resource to its pool for each character you control with a player attachment. You can only play 1 copy of Traffic from Dale each round.

property.name: Text
property.value: Action: Choose an ally with a player attachment. Ready that ally.

property.name: Text
property.value: Response: After a character is declared as an attacker or defender against an enemy with an attachment, that character gets +3 Û and +3 Ú until the end of this attack.

property.name: Text
property.value: Planning Action: Choose a ready player attachment on a character you control. Return that attachment to its owner’s hand to reduce the cost of the next attachment played this phase by X, where is the chosen attachment’s cost.

property.name: Text
property.value: Immune to player card effects. The Old Ford gets +5 quest points for each enemy in play. Forced: After The Old Ford becomes the active location, each enemy in the staging area makes an immediate attack against the first player.

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced: When Wooded Riverbank is explored, put the top card of the Evil Creatures deck into play engaged with the first player.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Shadow: Deal 1 damage to the defending character.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Add the top card of the Evil Creatures deck to the staging area and attach Frenzied Creature to it. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: “Attached enemy gets +1 $, +1 Û, +1 Ú and is immune to player card effects.”)

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Shadow: Attach this card to attacking enemy.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Each player assigns X damage among characters he controls, where X is the total $ of the active location. If X is less than 3, Treacherous Crossing gains surge.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û (+2 Û instead if the defending character is damaged).

property.name: Text
property.value: Cannot have player card attachments. While Goblin Troop is engaged with you, each other Goblin enemy engaged with you gets +1 Û and +1 Ú.

property.name: Text
property.value: While Stray Goblin is in the staging area, it gains: “Forced: After a player engages an enemy, Stray Goblin engages that player.”

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Shadow: Add Stray Goblin to staging area.

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced: If Pack of Wargs is dealt a shadow card with no effect, Pack of Wargs makes an additional attack after this one. (Do not deal it a shadow card.)

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Shadow: Return attacking enemy to the staging area after this attack.

property.name: Text
property.value: X is the number of characters controlled by the player with the most characters. Quest Action: Exhaust a character to reduce Hills of Wilderland $ by 1 until the end of the phase. Only the first player can trigger this effect.

property.name: Text
property.value: Lonely Lands gets +2 $ for each facedown card under it. While Lonely Lands is in the staging area, it gains: “Forced: After an event is played during the quest phase, place it facedown under Lonely Lands.”

property.name: Text
property.value: Doomed 1. When Revealed: Each player must choose: either raise your threat by 1 for each ally you control, or deal 1 damage to each ally you control.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Shadow: Raise your threat by 1 for each enemy engaged with you.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: The player with the most cards in his hand without a copy of Lost in the Wilderness adds Lost in the Wild to his hand. (While in a player’s hand, Lost in the Wild gains: “Cannot be discarded by player card effect. Forced: After you play a card, discard each card in your hand.”)

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Attach to the hero with the most attachments without Weighed Down attached. Then, exhaust attached hero. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: “Forced: After attached hero readies, choose and discard an attachment from it. You cannot choose Weighed Down unless attached hero has no other non-objective attachments.”)

property.name: Text
property.value: Each objective-location, and each card guarding one, is immune to player card effects. Forced: When progress would be placed on the main quest, if there are no objective-locations in play, discard an equal number of cards from the encounter deck instead. Then, put the topmost objective-location in the encounter discard pile into play.

property.name: Text
property.value: Guarded (location). Travel: Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. Each player discards the top card of the encounter deck and assigns X damage among characters he controls, where X is that card’s $. Forced: After the players travel here, advance to the next stage A, if able.

property.name: Text
property.value: Guarded (location). Travel: Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. Each player discards the top card of the encounter deck. Add each enemy discarded this way to the staging area. Forced: After the players travel here, advance to the next stage C, if able.

property.name: Text
property.value: Guarded (enemy). Travel: Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. Each player discards the top card of the encounter deck. Add each location discarded this way to the staging area. Forced: After the players travel here, advance to the next stage A, if able.

property.name: Text
property.value: Guarded (enemy). Travel: Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. Each player discards the top card of the encounter deck and raises his threat by X, where X is that card’s $. Forced: After the players travel here, advance to the next stage C, if able.

property.name: Text
property.value: Twilight Hall gets +2 $ for each resource on it. Forced: After a Forest location is explored, place 1 resource here. Travel: Raise each player’s threat by 1 for each resource here. If there are no resources on Twilight Hall, the players cannot travel here.

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced: At the end of the encounter phase, if Mirkwood Patrol is in the staging area with an unguarded objective-location, attach that objective-location to Mirkwood Patrol, guarding it.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Shadow: The defender cannot ready this round.

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced: After Ravenous Spider engages you, it makes an immediate attack.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Shadow: Attacking enemy makes an additional attack against you after this one.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Each player removes a character he controls from the quest and discards the top card of the encounter deck. If the discarded card’s printed $ is greater than the removed character’s Ò, discard that character.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +2 Û and +2 Ú if it is guarding a card.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Until the end of the phase, each non-objective location in the staging area gets +1 $ (+2 $ instead if it has at least 1 progress token on it). If the number of non-objective locations in the staging area is less than the number of players, Vastness of Mirkwood gains surge.

property.name: Text
property.value: While Accursed Forest is in the staging area, ‘when revealed’ effects cannot be canceled. Travel: Reveal the top card of the encounter deck.

property.name: Text
property.value: While Dark Black Woods is in the staging area, no more than 1 progress can be placed on each Forest location in the staging area each round. Travel: Each player discards the top card of the encounter deck. Add each enemy discarded this way to the staging area.

property.name: Text
property.value: Doomed 1. When Revealed: Each player must choose: either raise your threat by 1 for each ally you control, or reveal an encounter card.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û. If this attack destroys a character, discard an ally you control.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Each player discards each resource from each of his hero’s resource pools and raises his threat by 1 for each resource he discarded this way. If no resources were discarded this way, Swarm of Bats gains surge.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û (+2 Û instead if the defending character has an attachment).

property.name: Text
property.value: Cannot have non-Dragon attachments. X is 1 more than the number of players. Forced: After the active location is explored, Fire-drake returns to the staging area and makes an immediate attack against each player in turn order.

property.name: Text
property.value: Immune to player card effects. Fire-drake cannot take damage. Response: After Dragon Hoard becomes the active location, the first player chooses a player to attach an Artifact attachment from his hand to Dragon Hoard. That attachment gains the guarded (location) keyword. If that attachment has the printed guarded keyword, do not resolve it when the attachment enters play.

property.name: Text
property.value: While Iron Hills Mine is the active location, it gains: “Response: When Iron Hills Mine is explored, each player may return 1 card from his discard pile to his hand.” Travel: Each player discards the top 4 cards of his deck to travel here.

property.name: Text
property.value: Contested Depths gets +1 $ for each location in the victory display. Forced: After the players travel to Contested Depths, either raise each player’s threat by 1 for each location in the victory display, or discard Contested Depths and replace it with the top card of the Caves deck.

property.name: Text
property.value: When faced with the option to travel, the players must travel to Deep Chasm if there is no active location.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: The highest Û enemy in the staging area makes an immediate attack against the first player. If no attack is made this way, Denizen of the Deep gains surge.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Shadow: Attacking enemy makes an additional attack against you after this one.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Attach to a questing hero and remove it from the quest. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: “Limit 1 per hero. While the active location has the Dark trait, reduce attached hero’s Ò to 0 and treat its text box as if it were blank, except for Traits.”)

property.name: Text
property.value: Cannot have non-objective attachments. Forced: After Stone Troll attacks and destroys a character you control, discard 1 card from your hand for each excess point of damage dealt.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Shadow: Discard an attachment you control.

property.name: Text
property.value: While Hobgoblin is guarding a card, it gets +X $, +X Û, and +X Ú, where X is that card’s cost. Forced: After Hobgoblin enters play, the first player attaches the top card of his deck to Hobgoblin faceup as a guarded attachment. When Hobgoblin leaves play, return the card it was guarding to its owner’s hand.

property.name: Text
property.value: Werewolf gets +1 Û for each damage on it. Forced: After Werewolf is dealt a shadow card with no shadow effect, deal 1 damage to it and the defending character.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Shadow: Deal 1 damage to the defending character.

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced: After Giant Spider attacks and damages a character, that character cannot ready until the end of the round.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Shadow: Defending character cannot ready until the end of the round.

property.name: Text
property.value: While the active location has the Dark trait, Black Bats cannot take damage.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Shadow: If the active location has the Dark trait, attacking enemy cannot take damage this phase.

property.name: Text
property.value: While Dark Tunnel is in the staging area, progress cannot be placed on Dark locations in the staging area.

property.name: Text
property.value: Response: When you travel to Forked Passage (before resolving the deep keyword), raise each player’s threat by 2 to look at the top 2 cards of the Caves deck. Put 1 on top of the Caves deck and put the other on the bottom. Then, add Forked Passage to the victory display.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Add the total $ of the active location to the total $ in the staging area until the end of the phase. If there is no active location, discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until a location is discarded and add it to the staging area.

property.name: Text
property.value: Doomed 1. When Revealed: Each player must choose: either raise your threat by 1 for each questing character you control, or discard a questing character you control.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Shadow: If this attack is undefended, discard an ally you control.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Attach to a Dragon enemy. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: “Limit 1 per enemy. Forced: When attached enemy attacks you, deal 1 damage to each character you control. Then, discard Dragon Breath.”)

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Attach to a Dragon enemy. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: “Limit 1 per enemy. Forced: When attached enemy would take any amount of damage, cancel all of that damage. Then, discard Dragon Scales.”)

property.name: Text
property.value: Response: After Lost Armory becomes the active location, each player may search his deck for a Weapon or Armor attachment, add it to his hand, and shuffle his deck. Limit once per game for the group.

property.name: Text
property.value: Response: After Ancient Treasury becomes the active location, each player may (choose one): reduce his threat by 3, draw 2 cards, or add 1 resource to a hero’s resource pool. Limit once per game for the group.

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced: After Frightful Den becomes the active location, shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck and discard cards from the top until X enemies are discarded, where X is the number of players. Add each enemy discarded this way to the staging area.

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced: After the players commit characters to the quest, discard cards from the encounter deck until a treachery is discarded. Resolve the ‘when revealed’ effect on that treachery.

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced: After Crumbling Cavern becomes the active location, each player assigns X damage among characters he controls, where X is the number of characters he controls.

property.name: Text
property.value: X is the number of characters controlled by the player who controls the most characters. Forced: After an ally enters player, exhaust it.

property.name: Text
property.value: Setup: Set Woodman Village and The Old Ford aside, out of play. Create the Evil Creatures deck (see insert) and place it next to the quest deck. Shuffle the encounter deck and discard cards from the top until X locations are discarded, where X is the number of players. Add each discarded location to the staging area.

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced: After placing progress here from questing successfully, place 1 resource here. Forced: At the beginning of the encounter phase, remove 1 resource from this stage. Then, add the top card of the Evil Creatures deck to the staging area. This stage cannot be defeated while an enemy from the Evil Creatures deck is in play.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: The first player adds Woodman Village to the staging area. Each other player reveals an encounter card.

property.name: Text
property.value: No more than 1 progress can be placed on each location in the staging area each round. Forced: After the players travel to a location, add the top card of the Evil Creatures deck to the staging area. The players cannot defeat this stage unless the first player controls Haldan.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: The first player adds The Old Ford to the staging area. Each other player takes the top card of the Evil Creatures deck and adds it to the staging area.

property.name: Text
property.value: The players cannot travel to The Old Ford unless there is at least 5 progress here. Forced: At the beginning of the quest phase, add the top card of the Evil Creatures deck to the staging area. This stage cannot be defeated while The Old Ford is in play. When The Old Ford is explored, the players win the game.

property.name: Text
property.value: Immune to player card effects. Forced: When Woodman Village is explored, add the top card of the Evil Creatures deck to the staging area. Then, flip over Woodman Village and attach Haldan to the just-added enemy as a guarded objective.

property.name: Text
property.value: The first player gains control of Haldan while he is free of encounters. While there is an active location, Haldan does not exhaust to quest. If Haldan leaves play, the players lose the game.

property.name: Text
property.value: Setup: Set the Spiders of Mirkwood and Dol Guldur Orcs encounter sets aside, out of play. The first player takes control of Haldan and adds Searching for a Way Out to the staging area. Each player adds 1 Forest Spider to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

property.name: Text
property.value: Each player’s threat cannot be reduced by player card effects. Forced: After an enemy engages a player, raise that player’s threat by 1.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Shuffle the Spiders of Mirkwood encounter set into the encounter deck. Then, reveal 1 encounter card per player.

property.name: Text
property.value: The first Spider enemy revealed each quest phase gains surge. Forced: When a Spider enemy attacks and damages a character, that character cannot ready until the end of the round.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Shuffle the Dol Guldur Orcs encounter set into the encounter deck. Then, reveal 1 encounter card per player.

property.name: Text
property.value: The first Orc enemy revealed each quest phase gains surge. Forced: When an Orc enemy attacks and damages a character, that character’s controller chooses and discards 1 card from his hand.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Each player chooses a hero he controls, discards each token and attachment from that hero, and places it in the staging area. Each player discards cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded and attaches that enemy to the hero he owns in the staging area, guarding it.

property.name: Text
property.value: Each enemy guarding a hero cannot take non-combat damage. Each guarded hero is in play but under no player’s control. Forced: When an enemy guarding a hero is defeated, return that hero to its owner’s control exhausted. When the players advance from this stage, discard each guarded hero.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Each player discards cards from the top of the encounter deck until he discards a non-objective lcoation and adds it to the staging area. Each player places his hand of cards facedown under a different location in the staging area.

property.name: Text
property.value: Each location gets +1 quest point for each facedown player card under it. Forced: When a location with a facedown player card under it is explored, return each facedown player card under it to its owner’s hand. When the players advance from this stage, discard each facedown player card under a location.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Remove Searching for a Way Out from the game. Search the remaining set-aside encounter set for the enemy with the most hit points and add it to the staging area. That enemy is the “nemesis” until it leaves play.

property.name: Text
property.value: The nemesis gets +2 $, +2 Û, +2 Ú and is immune to player card effects. Forced: At the end of the round, return the nemesis to the staging area and it makes an attack against the first player. This stage cannot be defeated while the nemesis is in play. The nemesis cannot take damage unless there is at least 8 progress on this stage. If the players defeat the nemesis, they win the game.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Remove Searching for a Way Out from the game. Starting with the first player, each player discards cards from the top of the encounter deck until he discards an enemy and puts that enemy into play engaged with him.

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced: At the end of the round, raise each player’s threat by 1 for each enemy engaged with him. This stage cannot be defeated while a player is engaged with an enemy. When this stage is defeated, the players win the game.

property.name: Text
property.value: Setup: Build the Caves deck (see insert) and set it next to the quest deck. Set Fire-drake, Dragon Hoard, and the Dragon Might encounter sets aside, out of play. Shuffle the encounter deck. Each player discards cards from the top of the encounter deck until he discards an enemy or location and adds that card to the staging area.

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced: At the beginning of the quest phase, discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until a location is discarded. Either add that location to the staging area, or raise each player’s threat by X, where X is that location’s printed $. This stage cannot be defeated unless there are 3 locations with victory points in the victory display.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Place Dragon Hoard on the bottom of the Caves deck. Add Fire-drake to the staging area and shuffle the Dragon Might encounter set into the encounter deck.

property.name: Text
property.value: Fire-drake cannot leave the staging area or take damage. Response: After placing progress here from questing successfully, remove 5 progress from this stage to look at the top 2 cards of the Caves deck. Put one on top of the Caves deck and put the other on the bottom. After The Dragon Hoard becomes the active location, advance to stage 3A.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Dragon treachery and attach it to Fire-drake, if able. Shuffle the encounter deck.

property.name: Text
property.value: Ignore the Deep keyword. Forced: After a player declares X attackers against Fire-drake, he must remove X progress tokens from the main quest or cancel the attack. This stage cannot be defeated while Fire-drake is in play. If Fire-drake is defeated, the players win the game.
